newsitem.title: FRANCE: French cat survives month in wrecked building.
newsitem.headline: French cat survives month in wrecked building.

text.p: A French tabby cat survived for a month trapped in the rubble of a building demolished by an explosion in the Mediterranean port of Marseille, drinking only rainwater, a vet said on Friday.

The female cat, aged about 10, was extremely weak. "Cats have a great capacity for survival," vet Sophie Boudon told France 3 television. The cat, one of its back legs bandaged, lay on the table beside her.
The cat, trapped when a gas leak destroyed a block of flats on July 20 in Marseille, was uncovered this week. It survived only on rainwater trickling through the wreckage.
